newsArray.title: Harshit Rana Didn't Travel With Team India For 3rd T20I. The Reason Is...
newsArray.description: India vs Bangladesh, 3rd T20I: There was no debut for Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) pacer Harshit Rana, who was unavailable for selection after he didn't travel with the team to Hyderabad.

newsArray.title: Explained! Why Is Harshit Rana Not Playing India vs Bangladesh 3rd T20I?
creator: Faham Uddin
newsArray.description: India won the toss and opted to bat first against Bangladesh in the third T20I at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad. Harshit Rana was expected to make his debut for India but he did not travel with the team for the final T20I. The BCCI later updated fans about Rana's unavailability and the reason behind it.

newsArray.title: Women's T20 World Cup 2024: New Zealand Beat Sri Lanka By 8 Wickets, Tying With India At 4 Points In Group A Standings
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description: NZ-W vs SL-W Women‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2024: New Zealand women registered a convincing win over Sri Lanka Women in their third Group A match of the ICC Women‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2024 as the White Ferns defeated the Asia Cup 2024 champions by 8 wickets at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium, Sharjah on October 12 (Wednesday). With the win, New Zealand now have four points and stand level with Team India in terms of points, with four points in the tournament's points table. However, they are positioned third, behind second-positioned India, by virtue of having an inferior Net Run Rate (NRR).This victory places New Zealand in a favorable position for qualifying for the knockout stage. Despite India placed above them in the points table, New Zealand have a relatively easier match next up as they will now face Pakistan in their last group-stage match. India, on the other hand, have a much tougher match as they will lock horns with the defending champions and the only undefeated team in this tournament ‚Äî Australia. New Zealand claim a thrilling victory over Sri Lanka to strengthen semi-final case! üëåüìù: https://t.co/PDkkWD4qPb#NZvSL #T20WorldCup #WhateverItTakes pic.twitter.com/0mQDT24X18‚Äî T20 World Cup (@T20WorldCup) October 12, 2024 This is a developing news. More to follow...

newsArray.title: Why was Harshit Rana not given India cap in 3rd T20I against Bangladesh? BCCI gives major update
newsArray.description: Kolkata Knight Riders speedster Harshit Rana was not handed an India cap in the complete T20I series against Bangladesh. Harshit, an IPL winner with the KKR, was among the three specialist pacers in the Indian team for the series alongside Arshdeep Singh and tearaway Mayank Yadav. While Yadav was picked for all three T20Is and Arshdeep for two, Harshit warmed the benches for all the games.

newsArray.title: Women's T20 World Cup 2024: New Zealand Beat Sri Lanka By 8 Wickets, Tying With India At 4 Points In Group A Standings
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description: NZ-W vs SL-W Women‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2024: New Zealand women registered a convincing win over Sri Lanka Women in their third Group A match of the ICC Women‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2024 as the White Ferns defeated the Asia Cup 2024 champions by 8 wickets at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium, Sharjah on October 12 (Wednesday). With the win, New Zealand now have four points and stand level with Team India in terms of points, with four points in the tournament's points table. However, they are positioned third, behind second-positioned India, by virtue of having an inferior Net Run Rate (NRR).This victory places New Zealand in a favorable position for qualifying for the knockout stage. Despite India placed above them in the points table, New Zealand have a relatively easier match next up as they will now face Pakistan in their last group-stage match. India, on the other hand, have a much tougher match as they will lock horns with the defending champions and the only undefeated team in this tournament ‚Äî Australia. New Zealand claim a thrilling victory over Sri Lanka to strengthen semi-final case! üëåüìù: https://t.co/PDkkWD4qPb#NZvSL #T20WorldCup #WhateverItTakes pic.twitter.com/0mQDT24X18‚Äî T20 World Cup (@T20WorldCup) October 12, 2024 This is a developing news. More to follow...

newsArray.title: Why was Harshit Rana not given India cap in 3rd T20I against Bangladesh? BCCI gives major update
newsArray.description: Kolkata Knight Riders speedster Harshit Rana was not handed an India cap in the complete T20I series against Bangladesh. Harshit, an IPL winner with the KKR, was among the three specialist pacers in the Indian team for the series alongside Arshdeep Singh and tearaway Mayank Yadav. While Yadav was picked for all three T20Is and Arshdeep for two, Harshit warmed the benches for all the games.
